member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_Amplify(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets parameters for the amplify effect.
member.param: Sets the amplification for a channel. Default value is 10000, which means that no amplification occurs. A value of 20000 raises the amplification by 2. If separate is True, then every channel will be amplified by it's channel amplification value. If separate is False, then every channel is amplified with the value of channel 0.

Enables or Disables separate amplification. If Enabled every channel will be amplified by it's own amplification value. If Disabled every channel will be amplified with the amplification value of channel 0.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_BandPass(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the Band Pass effect.
member.param: Specifies the high cutoff frequency for a specific channel.
Specifies the low cutoff frequency for a specific channel.
Enables or Disables separate cutoff. If Enabled every channel will be processed by it's own cutoff value. If disabled every channel will be processed with the cutoff value of channel 0.
member.remarks: Filter to cutoff a certain Frequency Range. Each Channel can separate cutoff the Frequency range.

member.summary: Sets parameters for the channel order effect.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_DS_Chorus(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the DS Chorus effect.
member.param: Specifies the delay of the filter (0 - 20.0).
Specifies the depth of the filter (0 - 100.0).
Specifies the feedback of the filter (-99.0 - 99.0)
Specifies the frequency of the filter (0 - 10.0)

Specifies the phase angle. Use one of the following values. 0 for a phase shift of -180 degrees. 1 for a phase shift of -90 degrees. 2 for no phase shift. 3 for a phase shift of 90 degrees. 4 for a phase shift of 180 degrees. (0 - 4)
Specifies the waveform type of the filter. Use True for a triangle waveform and False for a sine waveform.
Specifies the wet and dry mix (0 - 100.0)
member.remarks: Chorus is a voice-doubling effect created by echoing the original sound with a slight delay and slightly modulating the delay of the echo.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_DS_Compressor(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the DS Compressor effect.
member.param: Specifies the attack time in ms (0.01 - 500).
Specifies the gain of the filter (-60.0 - 60.0).
Specifies the pre-delay of the filter (0.0 - 4.0)
Specifies the ratio of the filter (1.0 - 100.0).
Specifies the release time in ms (50.0 - 3000.0)
Specifies the threshold of the filter (-60.0 - 0.0)
member.remarks: Compression is a reduction in the fluctuation of a signal above a certain amplitude.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_DS_Distortion(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the DS Distortion effect.
member.param: Specifies the edge of the filter (0.0 - 100.0).
Specifies the gain of the filter (-60.0 - 0).
Specifies the bandwidth of the equalizer (100.0 - 8000.0).
Specifies the center frequency of the distortion equalizer (100.0 - 8000.0).
Specifies the low pass cutoff of the filter (100.0 - 8000.0).
member.remarks: Distortion is achieved by adding harmonics to the signal in such a way that, as the level increases, the top of the waveform becomes squared off or clipped.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_DS_Echo(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the DS Echo effect.
member.param: Specifies the feedback of the filter (0 - 100.0).
Specifies the left delay of the filter (1.0 - 2000.0).
Specifies the right delay of the filter (1.0 - 2000.0).
Specifies the wet and dry mix of the filter (0.0 - 100.0).
member.remarks: An echo effect causes sounds to be repeated after a fixed delay, usually at a diminished volume. As the repeated sounds are fed back into the mix, they are repeated again.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_DS_Flanger(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the DS Flanger effect.
member.param: Specifies the delay of the filter (0.0 - 4.0).
Specifies the depth of the filter (0.0 - 100.0).
Specifies the feedback of the filter (-99.0 - 99.0).
Specifies the frequency of the filter (0.0 - 10.0).

Specifies the phase angle. Use one of the following values. 0 for a phase shift of -180 degrees. 1 for a phase shift of -90 degrees. 2 for no phase shift. 3 for a phase shift of 90 degrees. 4 for a phase shift of 180 degrees. (0 - 4).
Specifies the waveform type of the filter. Use True for a triangle waveform and False for a sine waveform.
Specifies the wet and dry mix of the filter (0.0 - 100.0).
member.remarks: Flange, also called flanger, is an echo effect in which the delay between the original signal and its echo is very short and varies over time. The result is sometimes referred to as a sweeping sound. The term flange originated with the practice of grabbing the flanges of a tape reel to change the speed.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_DS_Gargle(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the DS Gargle effect.
member.param: Specifies the frequency of the gargle filter (1 - 1000).
Specifies the waveform type of the filter. Use for a triangle waveform and for a sine waveform.
member.remarks: The gargle effect modulates the amplitude of the signal.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_DS_ParamEQ(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the DS ParamEQ effect.
member.param: Specifies the bandwidth of the equalizer (1.0 - 36.0).
Specifies the center frequency of the equalizer (80.0 - 16000.0).
Specifies the gain of the equalizer (-15.0 - 15.0).
member.remarks: A parametric equalizer amplifies or attenuates signals of a given frequency. Parametric equalizer effects for different pitches can be applied in parallel by setting multiple instances of the effect on the same buffer. In this way, the application can have tone control similar to that provided by a hardware equalizer.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_DS_Reverb(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.String,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Single,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the DS Reverb effect.
member.param: Specifies the decay HF ratio for the filter (0.1 - 2.0, 0.83 by default).
Specifies the decay time for the filter (0.1 - 20.0, 1.49 by default).
Specifies the density value for the filter (0 - 100.0, 100.0 by default).
Specifies the diffusion value for the filter (0 - 100.0, 100.0 by default).
Specifies the HF reference for the filter (20.0 - 20000.0, 5000.0 by default).
Specifies the preset name of the filter.
Specifies the quality of the filter (0 - 3, 2 by default).
Specifies the reflections value for the filter (-10000 - -1000, -2602 by default).
Specifies the reflections delay for the filter (0.0 - 0.3, 0.007 by default).
Specifies the reverb value for the filter (-10000 - 2000, 200 by default).
Specifies the reverb delay for the filter (0.0 - 0.1, 0.011 by default).
Specifies the room value for the filter (-10000 - 0, -1000 by default).
Specifies the room HF value of the filter (-10000 - 0, -100 by default).
Specifies the room roll off factor for the filter (0.0 - 10.0, 0.0 by default).
member.remarks: Environmental Reverberation filter.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_DS_WavesReverb(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the DS Waves Reverb effect.
member.param: Specifies the high frequency ratio (0.001 - 0.999, 0.001 by default).
Specifies in-gain of the filter (-96.0 - 0.0, 0.0 by default).
Specifies the reverb mix of the filter (-96.0 - 0.0, 0.0 by default).
Specifies the reverb time of the filter (0.001 - 3000.0, 1000.0 by default).
member.remarks: The waves reverberation effect is intended for use with music. The waves reverberation DirectX Media Object (DMO) is based on the Waves MaxxVerb technology, which is licensed to Microsoft.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_DynamicAmplify(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the Dynamic Amplify effect.
member.param: Specifies the amplification value than will be used when amplifying.
Sets the amplification for a channel. Default value is 10000, which means that no amplification occurs. A value of 20000 raises the amplification by 2.
Specifies the time in milliseconds that the DSP will wait to continue amplification, after the maximum has been reached.
member.remarks: DSP Filter to automatically keep the volume eat a specific maximum value.

member.summary: Gets the value for the current amplification level.

member.summary: Sets the parameters for the Echo Delay effect.
member.param: Specifies the amplification of the echoes.
Specifies the delay in milliseconds of the echoes.
Specifies whether the delays will be passed through a high pass filter.
Specifies whether the main signal should be deleted.
member.remarks: DSP Echo/Delay Filter that supports multiple echoes.

member.summary: Enables selected audio effect.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_Equalizer(System.Int32,VisioForge.Types.VFFFTSize,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the Equalizer effect.
member.param: Sets the FFT size that will be used for the equalization. The number of bands the equalizer will have is always half of the FFT size.

Enables or Disables separate equalization. If Enabled every channel will be equalized by it's own amplification value. If Disabled every channel will be equalized with the amplification value of channel 0.
member.remarks: Equalizer Filter that can equalize from 1 (2 point FFT) up to 4096 bands (8192 point FFT). Each channel can be equalized separately.

member.summary: Sets the parameters for the Flanger effect.
member.param: Specifies the delay time in seconds.
Specifies whether the added signal should be inverted.

Enables or Disables separate amplification. If Enabled every channel will be amplified by it's own amplification value. If Disabled every channel will be amplified with the amplification value of channel 0.
member.remarks: Filter to flange audio data. Every channel can be controlled separately.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_HighPass(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the High Pass effect.
member.param: Specifies the cutoff frequency for a specific channel at which the cutoff will start.
Enables or Disables separate cutoff. If Enabled every channel will be processed by it's own cutoff value. If Disabled every channel will be processed with the cutoff value of channel 0.
member.remarks: Filter that cuts Frequencies from a specified frequency to half of the sampling rate. Each channel can be separate processed with different cutoff values.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_LowPass(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the Low Pass effect.
member.param: Specifies the cutoff frequency for a specific channel at which the cutoff will end.
Enables or Disables separate cutoff. If Enabled every channel will be processed by it's own cutoff value. If Disabled every channel will be processed with the cutoff value of channel 0.
member.remarks: Filter that cuts frequencies from 0 to a specified frequency. Each channel can be separate processed with different cutoff values.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_Notch(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the Notch effect.
member.param: Specifies the cutoff frequency for a specific channel at which the cutoff will have it's maximum amplification.
Enables or Disables separate cutoff. If Enabled every channel will be processed by it's own cutoff value. If Disabled every channel will be processed with the cutoff value of channel 0.
member.remarks: Filter that cuts frequency's in a wide range of specified frequency. Each channel can be separate processed with different cutoff values.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_ParametricEQ(System.Int32,System.Single,System.Single,System.Single,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the ParametricEQ effect.
member.param: Specifies the center frequency of the filter.
Specifies the gain in DB of the filter.
Specifies the Q (bandwidth) of the filter.

Enables or Disables separate amplification. If Enabled every channel will be amplified by it's own amplification value. If Disabled every channel will be amplified with the amplification value of channel 0.

member.summary: Sets the parameters for the Phase Invert effect.
member.param: Enables and Disables phase invert for a specific channel.
Enables or Disables separate invert. If Enabled every channel will be inverted by it's own invert value. If Disabled every channel will be inverted by the value of channel 0.
member.remarks: Phase invert component that inverts specific channels.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_Phaser(System.Int32,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Single,System.Boolean,System.Byte,System.Single)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the Phaser effect.
member.param: Sets dry-wet mix ratio. 0 - dry, 255 - wet (0 - 255).
Sets phaser feedback. 0 - no feedback, 100 = 100% feedback, -100 = -100% feedback (-100 - 100).
Enables or Disables separate phasing. If Enabled every channel will be phased by it's own phasing value. If Disabled every channel will be phased with the phasing value of channel 0.
Sets phaser stages. Recommended from 2 to 24.
Sets phaser's LFO start phase in radians. Needed for stereo phasers.
member.remarks: Class for phasing amplify audio data. Phasing can be done separate on each channel.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_PitchScale(System.Int32,VisioForge.Types.VFFFTSize,System.Int32,System.Byte,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the Pitch Scale effect.
member.param: Specifies the FFTSize that will be used. The size must be at last 256. A value of 1024 is recommended.
Specifies the pitch of a channel. Default value is 1000 which means that the pitch isn't changed.
Specifies the quality of the filter. Note that large values require a lot of CPU time. A value of 8-32 is recommended.

Enables or Disables separate amplification. If Enabled every channel will be amplified by it's own amplification value. If Disabled every channel will be amplified with the amplification value of channel 0.
member.remarks: Component to increase/decrease the pitch of an audio buffer without changing the tempo.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_PitchShift(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the Pitch Shift effect.
member.param: Specifies the pitch. Default value is 1000, which means that no pitch is done. A value of 2000 increases the playback by 200% and so on.
member.remarks: Pitch shift filter to increase speed and pitch of audio data.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_SetCurrentChannel(System.Int32,System.Byte)
member.summary: Sets the current audio channel for the audio effects.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_Sound3D(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the Sound3D effect.
member.param: Sets the 3D amplification value. A value of 1000 is the same as disabling the filter. Values smaller then 1000 is the same as doing a downmix (mono) of the 2 channels. Values higher then 10000 will distort the sound.
member.remarks: 3D Sound amplification filter that works on 2 channels only. The difference between left and right channel is calculated and added to the main signal.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_Tempo(System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the Tempo effect.
member.remarks: Filter to inc/decrease the tempo without changing the pitch.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_TrebleEnhancer(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the Treble Enhancer effect.
member.param: Specifies the frequency range that will be used to amplify. Range is frequency to (sample rate div 2).

Enables or Disables separate amplification. If Enabled every channel will be amplified by it's own amplification value. If Disabled every channel will be amplified with the amplification value of channel 0.

Sets the amplification for a channel. Default value is 0, which means that no amplification occurs. The value shouldn't go over 10000. If separate is True, then every channel will be amplified by its own channel amplification value. If separate is False, then every channel is amplified with the value of channel 0.
member.remarks: Filter to amplify high frequency's of audio data. The frequency range can be adjusted.

member.name: M:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_Effects_TrueBass(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Boolean,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the parameters for the True Bass effect.
member.param: Specifies the frequency range that will be used to amplify. Range is 0 to frequency.

Enables or Disables separate amplification. If Enabled every channel will be amplified by it's own amplification value. If Disabled every channel will be amplified with the amplification value of channel 0.

Sets the amplification for a channel. Default value is 0, which means that no amplification occurs. The value shouldn't go over 10000. If separate is True, then every channel will be amplified by its own channel amplification value. If separate is False, then every channel is amplified with the value of channel 0.
member.remarks: Filter to amplify low frequency's of audio data. The frequency range can be adjusted.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_LAME_CBR_Bitrate
member.summary: Gets or sets value for the audio lame bit rate.
member.remarks: For MPEG-1 (sampling frequencies of 32, 44.1 and 48 kHz) bit rate = 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 80, 96, 112, 128, 160, 192, 224, 256, 320 For MPEG-2 (sampling frequencies of 16, 22.05 and 24 kHz) bit rate = 8, 16, 24, 32, 40, 48, 56, 64, 80, 96, 112, 128, 144, 160 Default is 128 kbps for MPEG1 and 64 kbps for MPEG-2.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_LAME_Channels_Mode
member.summary: Gets or sets channels mode.
member.remarks: Joint-stereo is the default mode for stereo files with VBR when -V is more than 4 or fixed bit rates of 160kbs or less. At higher fixed bit rates or higher VBR settings, the default is stereo. Stereo: In this mode, the encoder makes no use of potentially existing correlations between the two input channels. It can, however, negotiate the bit demand between both channel, i.e. give one channel more bits if the other contains silence or needs less bits because of a lower complexity. Joint stereo: In this mode, the encoder will make use of a correlation between both channels. The signal will be matrixed into a sum (“mid”), computed by L+R, and difference (“side”) signal, computed by L-R, and more bits are allocated to the mid channel. This will effectively increase the bandwidth if the signal does not have too much stereo separation, thus giving a significant gain in encoding quality. Using mid/side stereo inappropriately can result in audible compression artifacts. To much switching between mid/side and regular stereo can also sound bad. To determine when to switch to mid/side stereo, LAME uses a much more sophisticated algorithm than that described in the ISO documentation, and thus is safe to use in joint stereo mode. Dual channels: In this mode, the 2 channels will be totally independently encoded. Each channel will have exactly half of the bit rate. This mode is designed for applications like dual languages encoding (ex: English in one channel and French in the other). Using this encoding mode for regular stereo files will result in a lower quality encoding. Mono: The input will be encoded as a mono signal. If it was a stereo signal, it will be downsampled to mono. The downmix is calculated as the sum of the left and right channel, attenuated by 6 dB.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_LAME_Copyright
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether LAME copyright tag enabled.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_LAME_CRC_Protected
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether LAME CRC tag enabled.
member.remarks: Adds the cyclic redundancy check (CRC) code in each frame, allowing to detect transmission errors that could occur on the MP3 stream. However, it takes 16 bits per frame that would otherwise be used for encoding, and then will be slightly reduced the sound quality.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_LAME_Disable_Short_Blocks
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether LAME short blocks disabled.
member.remarks: Encodes all frames using long blocks only. This could increases quality when encoding at very low bitrates, but can produces serious pre-echo artifacts.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_LAME_Enable_Xing_VBR_Tag
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether LAME Xing VBR tag enabled.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_LAME_Encoding_Quality
member.summary: Gets or sets LAME encoding quality.
member.remarks: Bit rate is of course the main influence on quality. The higher the bit rate, the higher the quality. However, for a given bit rate, we have a choice of algorithms to determine the best scale factors and Huffman encoding (noise shaping). 0: Use slowest and best possible version of all algorithms. 0 and 1 are slow and may not produce significantly higher quality. 2: Recommended. 5: Default value. Good speed, reasonable quality. 7: Very fast, ok quality. (psycho acoustics are used for pre-echo and M/S, but no noise shaping is done. 9: Disables almost all algorithms including psy-model. Results as poor quality.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_LAME_Force_Mono
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether multi-channel audio will be downmuxed to mono.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_LAME_Keep_All_Frequencies
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether all frequiencies will be saved.
member.remarks: Keeps all frequencies. (Disables all filters). LAME will automatically apply various types of lowpass filters. This is because the high frequency coefficients can take up a lot of bits that would be better used for lower, more important frequencies. This property will disable all lowpass filtering. Not recommended.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_LAME_Mode_Fixed
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether "Mode fixed" tag enabled.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_LAME_Original
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether original tag enabled.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_LAME_Sample_Rate

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.Audio_LAME_Strictly_Enforce_VBR_Min_Bitrate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether minimal VBR bitrate will be enforced.
member.remarks: This is mainly for use with hardware players that do not support low bit rate mp3. Without this option, the minimum bit rate will be ignored for passages of analog silence, ie when the music level is below the absolute threshold of human hearing (ATH).

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.AForge_Motion_Detection_Enabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether AForge motion detection enabled.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.AForge_Motion_Detection_ProcessorType
member.summary: Gets or sets AForge motion detection processor type.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.AForge_Motion_Detection_DetectorType
member.summary: Gets or sets AForge motion detection detector type.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.AForge_Motion_Detection_DifferenceThreshold
member.summary: Gets or sets difference threshold value, [1 - 255].
member.remarks: The value Gets or sets the amount off difference between pixels, which is treated as motion pixel. Default value is set to 15. Applicable for all detectors.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.AForge_Motion_Detection_SuppressNoise
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether noise will be suppresed.
member.remarks: The value Gets or sets if additional filtering should be done to suppress standalone noisy pixels by applying 3x3 erosion image processing filter. See KeepObjectsEdges property, if it is required to restore edges of objects, which are not noise. Default value is set to true. Applicable for all detectors.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.AForge_Motion_Detection_KeepObjectsEdges
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether objects edges will be restored after noise suppression.
member.remarks: The value Gets or sets if additional filtering should be done to restore objects edges after noise suppression by applying 3x3 dilatation image processing filter. Default value is set to false. Turning the value on leads to more processing time of video frame. Applicable for Simple Background Modeling Detector and Custom Frame Difference Detector.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.AForge_Motion_Detection_HighlightColor
member.summary: Gets or sets AForge motion detection highlight color, used to highlight motion regions.
member.remarks: Default value is set to red color. Applicable for all processors.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.AForge_Motion_Detection_HighlightMotionRegions
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether motion regions will be highlighted.
member.remarks: The property Gets or sets if detected moving objects should be highlighted with rectangle or not. Default value is set to true. Turning the value on leads to additional processing time of video frame. Applicable for Blob Counting Objects processor.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.AForge_Motion_Detection_MinObjectsHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets minimum height of acceptable object.
member.remarks: The property sets minimum height of an object to count and highlight. If objects have smaller height, they are not counted and are not highlighted. Default value is set to 10. Applicable for Blob Counting Objects processor.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.AForge_Motion_Detection_MinObjectsWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets minimum width of acceptable object.
member.remarks: The property sets minimum width of an object to count and highlight. If objects have smaller width, they are not counted and are not highlighted. Default value is set to 10. Applicable for Blob Counting Objects processor.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.AForge_Motion_Detection_GridHeight
member.summary: Gets or sets height of motion grid, [2, 64].
member.remarks: The property Gets or sets motion grid's height - number of grid rows. Default value is set to 16. Applicable for Grid Motion Area processor.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.AForge_Motion_Detection_GridWidth
member.summary: Gets or sets width of motion grid, [2, 64].
member.remarks: The property Gets or sets motion grid's width - number of grid columns. Default value is set to 16. Applicable for Grid Motion Area processor.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.AForge_Motion_Detection_HighlightMotionGrid
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether motion grid will be highlighted.
member.remarks: The property Gets or sets if motion grid should be highlighted - if cell, which have motion level above the specified value, should be highlighted. Default value is set to true. Turning the value on leads to additional processing time of video frame. Applicable for Grid Motion Area processor.

member.name: P:VisioForge.VideoCapture.VideoCaptureSlave.AForge_Motion_Detection_MotionAmountToHighlight
member.summary: Gets or sets motion amount to highlight cell.
member.remarks: The property Gets or sets motion level threshold for highlighting grid's cells. If motion level of a certain cell is higher than this value, then the cell is highlighted. Default value is set to 0.15. Applicable for Grid Motion Area processor.
